Reviews.Title: “VIEWS, and a lot of (silly) fun”
Reviews.Author: Gandaratravels
Reviews.Content: I'd say this is one of the top places to stay in NYC right now: amazing views, really fun design throughout, excellent location, fantastic people watching, and decent food plus free wifi. Aside from it's lack of a pool, I see it as the best of the meatpacking bunch (Maritime, Gansavoort, Jane, Dream Downtown, Soho House). It is silly and trendy, but thoughtfully and enjoyably so.

Reviews.Title: “Uncompensated injury”
Reviews.Author: Scott F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the standard in September of 2011. Within 10 minutes of arriving my wife sliced the bottom of her toe on a very sharp glazed tile at the entry to the bathroom. The bathroom floor is raised by about two inches; a very dangerous design. My report of the injury was met initially with indifference. We spent our first night in New York in the emergency room, where my wife received eight stitches. Upon checking out, I again addressed my wife's injury. We were asked to provide information to their insurance company. For the past six months we have been requesting compensation for my wife's medical bills. We have received nothing. We have been ignored and delayed. We have received redundant requests for information we have already provided. I would encourage you to avoid is hotel as they clearly do not care about their patrons. Such a major disappointment and incredibly unprofessional. Disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “great stay-cation”
Reviews.Author: adrest
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, but not overly so. they keep it cool but know how to smile. excellent location to enjoy the high line, west village and high line. great restaurants nearby. loved our room. will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, holes in the sheets.”
Reviews.Author: annyong1
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Standard but would never pay full price. They had a deal on Jetsetter so I decided to buy it as a birthday treat. Beautiful view, stylish room, friendly service, great bath tub, and robes. However, I was surprised to find multiple holes in the sheets. Also, room keys dont appear to work to go to the roof bar. There was a line outside to get in so we didn't even get to check it out. There are better options in New York, at much lower prices. (the next night we stayed in the Yotel which was fantastic!)

Reviews.Title: “Standard in NYC”
Reviews.Author: chett a
Reviews.Content: The hotel experience was great and the service was friendly and attentive. Great food and beverage options without having to leave the hotel. Great views of the highline. Ill be back

Reviews.Title: “So classy I felt like I was in a movie”
Reviews.Author: S_B_817
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a night in The Standard with my boyfriend and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location, in the meatpacking district which is a very classy and trendy area. The rooms were spacious and clean, both of which are often difficult to come by, especially in the city. The staff was courteous and we had an excellent view overlooking the Hudson River. In addition, the bar on the top floor was an experience I will never forget; a live band, great drinks, and a beautiful view of the entire city. Overall, we had an incredible time in the city which was largely due to our experience at the Standard.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel....but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: disab3476
Reviews.Content: No place to put luggage. The closet was too shallow to use. There was no option but the peek a boo showers. All in all a fun hotel but nothing to really justify the high rates

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but no club entrance”
Reviews.Author: screen180572
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really great and it is beautifull from inside and outside. A big disadvantage was that we thought we would have the possibility to go in the nice club for USD 500 but this was not possible without bottled service.

Reviews.Title: “The Standard in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Amy S
Reviews.Content: A great hotel- excellent rooms with great amenities and good views...spacious enough considering NYC hotel rooms. Superior, friendly service and the hotel boasts excellent bars for amazing people watching in a cool, trendy neighbourhood. Pillows and sheets were so good - I asked brand names!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Views!”
Reviews.Author: WillD1289
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Standard recently for my birthday and had a great time! We arrived late in the evening and the front desk was very helpful, check in was a breeze. I think our front desk agent's name was Terrell, he was super nice and helped us find a great room. The room was fantastic, but nothing can compare to the views!! We were only on the 7th floor, but youâ€™d be hard pressed to find a cooler view in the entire city! Aside from the rooms, both the Grill and the bars were worth the trip. I couldnâ€™t get enough of the Biergarten (itâ€™s enclosed during the cold weather) and my girlfriend loved Le Bain. Between the views, the food and the party, I will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Short biz trip... Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: epirate
Reviews.Content: Incredible service and stunning views of the lower Hudson River....

Reviews.Title: “Fun Night @ the Standard”
Reviews.Author: EvanandNalasDad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled up from DC to spend an evening away from the kids for my birthday and thought it would be cool to re-live a time in our life when we were a bit more hip. We chose to stay at The Standard Hotel in the Meatpacking district in NYC. From our first arrival we were greeted by a very friendly hostess who immediately did her best to try to find us a nicer room than the one that was reserved for us. While the new room was being cleaned she treated us to a complementary cocktail at the bar. When we got a chance to go up to our room (the elevators are wild by the way) we found the minimalist style and use of space to be quaint and attractive. The views of the High Line and the Hudson were breath taking. Although we didn't spend much time in the lounge on the 18th floor it was incredible. Awesome views of both downtown and uptown. It was classy and elegant without being stuffy. We should have stayed awhile but we were meeting guest. Altogether this was a great experience and one I will be looking forward to having again. Make no mistake, The Standard is an ultra hip and ultra chic hotel that may turn you off if you are a little too sensitive and don't get with it. It was fun for us. They made a 30 something couple with two kids feel like we were still young and hip, if only for 1 night!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great hotel, very clean but no coffee pot?”
Reviews.Author: Carla321
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at this hotel! My room was near the elevators so there was some hallway noise but nothing crazy. The view was spectacular from the room!! My only question would be why no coffee pot? It ended up costing me $20 each morning for coffee and a glass of orange juice! I thought that was unfair plus they added $4 delivery and 18% grat. Also a makeup mirror by table would have been another great added touch for the price of the room. I was in the superior queen!

Reviews.Title: “Step Outside The Norm”
Reviews.Author: Pat R
Reviews.Content: Girlfriend and I stayed for a night in a room overlooking the Hudson and southern half of City. Amazing view, and great room. A bit of a European feel to the room (Bathroom, Shower), most comfortable bed I've slept on in a hotel. Your stay will be a unique experience from the lobby to your room. Staff was very customer-service oriented, pleasant, and hip. The bar on the 18th floor was our most enjoyable aspect of our night, with a band reminiscent of the swing era of the 20s and gorgeous views (come with a full wallet).

Reviews.Title: “I've never had a bad experience here!”
Reviews.Author: Chriskilkus
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Standard Hotel several times now and always had a great stay. The rooms are really nice and comfortable. And if you get the south side of the hotel the view is amazing! The restaurant and bars are great too, and love the neighborhood. The only thing that would be nice is if hotel guests would be allowed to stay in the upstairs bar past 10:30PM... I guess it turns into a private club then and everyone is kicked out?

Reviews.Title: “Questionable style, no substance but a great view.”
Reviews.Author: JuJuRaxy
Reviews.Content: As designers, we felt it was our responsibility to stay at the Standard, and we saw things about "design" that reinforced the schism between style and substance. The design of the rooms is more like a cabin than a hotel room. It's like a talented first year interior design project, where the student is redesigning your life without having actually lived yet themselves: no door on bathroom, bed has only one side and has a personality disorder ("am I couch? Am I bed?"). Some of the finishes are so experimental that they are delaminating pretty quickly (car trim sits uncomfortably on timber wall panel with embarrassing gap). There were numerous moments like this of material failure. The hotel is really a party place and if you want a nice nights sleep, don't think of staying above the 8th floor, due to the Boom Boom night club mentioned in other reviews. It really seems like a place for a single person or a bucks weekend for people with too much money. It should be noted that when we decided to leave, the staff were very helpful and sympathetic. The view in itself is extraordinary and almost worth it just for this reason, just for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Too cool”
Reviews.Author: Mal562
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a recent business trip and loved the neighborhood - totally different NY experience from anywhere else I've stayed. Cars went slowly down the streets rather than zooming by. The rather precarious design over the High Line path is a little scary looking from the outside and the inside is equally modern. Chairs in the lobby are so low to the ground I wasn't sure i would be able to get back up. The elevators are a little hard to find - lots of black walls that all look alike. Rooms were decent sized but the bed is a platform style and again quite low to the ground. The shower has a glass wall so keep this in mind if you are not travelling with someone you want to see take a shower... The room had a smell like it was cleaned with Windex each day but it was clean. The view is really nice from very large windows (there was a letter on the desk reminding guests to close the curtains since there seems to have been some issue with exhibitionism). The front desk was really nice and I would recommend The Standard if you need to stay in this neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Cool”
Reviews.Author: tgg94
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was great. Firstly, the entire staff was, in addition to looking like part time models, super nice and attentive. The scary-cool art installation in the elevator should also be mentioned. The hotel room itself had amazing floor to ceiling views. The decor was cool, but the room happened to smell a bit like a mix of cigarette and sweat. Another negative was that on the first night, the boom boom room (night club on the top floor) was playing music so loud I could feel it from the ceiling ALL NIGHT. The shower was a bit inconvenient too, as the drain was under the sink. In all, the great hotel restaurant, service and interesting neighborhood definitely made up for the minor cons.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive exterior but mediocre experience staying there.”
Reviews.Author: Kemstar
Reviews.Content: Free wireless is appalling and the ironing board is only useful if your ironing clothes for someone the size of a oompa - lumpa. Style over substance I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Recent trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: PaulLancaster_SF
Reviews.Content: Had another great time at TheStandard NYC. Front desk person Amal Bijou was fantastically nice and helpful during my stay. She rocks. Front Desk Manager Paul Kashman was also very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time at The Standard”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Thyme
Reviews.Content: #1: Best Elevator Ride ever #2: Dream View - had to leave curtains open all night just so i could see the Empire State Building from the bed #3: Attended a memorable event in The Boom Boom Room and would do it again in a heartbeat If you plan to self-park and save the extravagant valet fee, drop off your luggage before you go park. If you are staying multiple days, the valet parking is not a bad deal. Eat at the Chelsea Market nearby, walk the Highline Park. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best vibe, best F&B, best views - best NY Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rickyjames88
Reviews.Content: Last weekend was the third time I stayed at The Standard NY. Incredible as usual, and this time I stayed with my girlfriend in a corner room (1211) featuring the best views of Hudson, downtown and also Mid town/Empire. Mind blowing to wake up with that view every morning (was lucky and had a lot of sun). Great room and I really have no complains. F&B was great all the way through. Love to start the evening in Bier Garten or at the Boom Boom Room. NY Strip @ Grille is always an experience itself and a late night signature cocktail at Boom Boom tips off an amazing night, even though we call it a standard night:) And when you wake the next day (perhaps with a heavy hangover) don't, for the love of God, miss the room service Standard Burger. No other hotel in the world can compete on that one. Really, the Standard is an outstanding hotel experience invented by hotel genius Andre Balatz and brought to you by one of the best hotel teams in the world. Next time I will probably try the new East Village property, but I will always return to the original NY Standard at some point while spending time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, downtown hotel, worth the vibe and the views.”
Reviews.Author: Farzad S
Reviews.Content: Everyone knows The Standard is a "cool" hotel. On my and my girlfriend's recent stay, it both lived up to this trendy reputation (impressive architecture, designer rooms, polished staff) and attended to all our basic needs. Its location in NY's "meatpacking" district, moreover, is totally awesome â€“ waterfront adjacent, lots of restaurants and clubs nearby, the Chelsea Market, and the AMAZING High Line (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_Line_(New_York_City). Best moments: sunset over the Hudson from the bathtub, and 360-degree views of Manhattan over drinks at the Boom Boom Room (penthouse bar/lounge). Put simply, we would stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “So Cool and very cosy”
Reviews.Author: erasmus45z
Reviews.Content: I'm not cool. I'm a mother to 4 and a country bumpkin. I have labradors, live on a farm and I always seem to trail mud where ever I go. My husband had to go on a business trip to New York and I decided to join him. I saw a Lonely Planet magazine in the News Agent with New York on the cover. So I bought it. The New York they talked about was the rejuvenated meatpacking area and the High Line, a disused suspended railway line that used to service the meat industry and now has been reinvigorated by clever landscaping. Very interesting and away from the hustle and bustle that slightly freaks me out. There are many hotels in the area, but The Standard straddles the High Line! It's so cool and I was worried I would feel out of place. But no, when our taxi turned into the street outside the hotel, we were greeted by a very welcoming and friendly guy. Our check in was effortless and our trip in the lift to our room an experience. Our room was great and cosy, with views over Manhattan and the Hudson River. The mini bar was incredibly well stocked and the toiletries extremely generous and replenished on a daily basis. The Bar on the 18th floor is unmissable and has one of the best views around. A trip to the loo is also a must! Breakfast was really good as well, a good mixture of really healthy, Ok for you and down right unhealthy. Fresh juices!! Sweet waiters and waitresses. Everyone was happy, fellow guests were happy and chatty. We were all having the time of our life.

Reviews.Title: “Uber-trendy hotel in hip neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: no_map
Reviews.Content: So to start, I should state that this review is not for the fashionistas, hipsters and trend-setters. This is for the perpetually un-hip like myself. If someone asks you "Why is the hotel logo upside down?" and you first thought IS NOT "Isn't it obvious?", then this review is for you. I stayed here for a recent business trip and the first indication that I was out of my element was that I walked around the hotel, not once, but TWICE trying to find the entrance. Eventually, I found it - to spare yourself the trouble, look for the unmarked yellow revolving door. Inside you will find the trappings of a modern, trendy hotel from the stylish lobby to the "heaven and hell" montages in the elevator. There is also an attached lounge (nice for a nightcap on those cold winter nights), beer garden and associated restaurant (the Standard Grill). There is a well-equipped gym on the 17th floor with excellent views of the city. My room was on the small side but well organized with a queen bed and room for a small couch and desk (yes, there aren't many outlets but they are there, mostly hidden behind furniture). There is also free Wi-Fi, a must for any business stay. Note the beds tend to be low so take that into account if you are used to a more elevated sleeping experience. Taking a cue from the modern hotels in Europe, the room features an open bathroom that opens right into the main room, I guess for all the voyeurs out there. It did feature a large garden tub which is a welcome addition to any hotel room. Not sure if this is the same in all the rooms but my bathroom area was elevated - if you weren't paying attention you could easily take a header onto the tile floor. Of course, the best feature of the room (and probably the reason you will want to book here) is for the floor to ceiling windows with magnificent views of NY city and the Hudson. NY has an amazing skyline day or night and especially at elevation. Those same windows seem to have attracted some exhibitionists who have performed free but most likely unwelcome "shows" to the chagrin of the people strolling along the High Line (this is the park that has been built on an old elevated railway line which cuts through the Standard). However, that practice is now frowned upon as noted by the message from management to be aware of the transparency of the windows. The service here is friendly and unassuming and I would rate that part highly. Things get taken care without much fuss - the rooms getting cleaned and the mini-bar refreshed seemingly on their own. Other reviewers have commented on the lack of access to the club on the top floor. This is true - you can use it before 10pm but afterwards, if you are un-hip like me, you will be turned away at the door. But that's OK - you haven't had an authentic NY experience unless you've been turned away at the door somewhere so check that off your list! So most likely you heard of this hotel since it was recommended by your more trendy friends. You will end up going if you want to experience a stylish hotel in a fashionable neighborhood with incredible views of the city and exceptional service and are willing to be a fish out of water for a wild, noisy, disorienting weekend and mingle with club kids, trendy locals and jet setting European tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Business stay at the Standard”
Reviews.Author: Sara T
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Standard in the Meatpacking District several times. Each time has been better than the last! The hotel is gorgeous and maintains the highest of standards when it comes to customer service! I am always on business trips and rarely get to experience the amazing atmosphere The Standard displays. The Standard Grill is an exceptional restaurant which allows me to not have to go far for a great meal!! All the most incredible designers have shops very close (within two to three blocks) so I am able to never have to leave the Meat Packing District! The Boom Boom Room upstairs is some of the best night life NYC has to offer and again its all right there! Such an amazing place, I highly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay at a chic hotel for business or pleasure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst night's sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: liz w
Reviews.Content: If you plan to go to sleep at 2:00 am or later every night, then the Standard Hotel is for you. Otherwise, do not stay here. The nightclub at the Standard takes priority over its guests, so do not be suprised if the bass from the club reverberates into your room and wakes you up in the middle of the night. Even if you are located SIX FLOORs below the club! The front desk must get complaints all the time. If you call to complain, they will actually will offer you earplugs! Despite its' sexy vibe and beautiful views, the Standard is the hotel that never sleeps. So if you want to be tired during your trip to NYC, this is the place for you. PS: you also can't shower at this hotel. The showers are very poorly designed and therefore showering is s a messy, freezing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel - Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: paradisetrip
Reviews.Content: Standard is a hip hotel. walking distance to loads of restaurants/bars in the meatpacking district. Subway is a 15 minute walk. We were in a standard king room. TINY rooms. Would only recommend this hotel if you wanted to stay in the area

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Hondrelis
Reviews.Content: This hotel hotel is far from the standard :) I proposed at this hotel, and the staff was really helpfull with making it perfect. The view was beautiful from the room, and the room service was excellent. Some of the best food I ever had. Con: There is an indoor pool, and a supposedly a nice view from the top of the hotel, but we were not allowed up there. Wrong place at the wrong time.. but still a little bit anoying. Pros: Plenty! Super cool and hip hotel, great staff, nice location. Awesome food.

Reviews.Title: “"Hello New York"”
Reviews.Author: Kate L
Reviews.Content: That's what I said every time I woke in the morn and saw the beautiful sunrise over the city. I've had to travel to NYC once a month for the past 5 months and my best hotel experience by far was at The Standard. The staff was genuinely kind and helpful The lobby is chic, yet comfortable The 18th floor lounge is amazing! great menu and drinks...but the decor and view were breathtaking I loved that the beer garden and the Standard Grill were right around the corner I loved that Chelsea market and the High Line were within a minute walk But my favorite was my room. The tub was HUGE and the rainforest shower - well, if I could have fit it in my bag, I would have. The room was cozy and quiet and very functional. I loved it and will ONLY stay at The Standard NY going forward

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Caroline G
Reviews.Content: Wevhad a lovely time at The Standard but the rooms are tiny. I have stayed in lots of places in NewYork but have never come across rooms so small. Having said that the hotel is fantastically placed down on the west side. I had not stayed that low before and thoroughly enjoyed the area. I did enjoy The Standard don't get me wrong, the restaurant and bar were great, the staff very personable. Nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Rtb5
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a short or long week end in new York. Service great and food very good. The boum boum bar the place to be in Manhattan

Reviews.Title: “Great Balance of Substance and Style”
Reviews.Author: amityman
Reviews.Content: I was looking through the reviews and saw some comments that were not indicative of the experience I had at The Standard NY. The front desk staff were very friendly as well as the concierge team. Excellent housekeeping service! I asked for some extra toiletries and they could not have been nicer. Bathroom and bedroom very clean. The Bellmen were quite the characters. Lots of fun chatting with them while watching people ice skate on the rink in front of the hotel. Food and service in the Standard Grill was fantastic-I will definitely be back !

Reviews.Title: “The standard is now set, how can we stay anywhere else now?”
Reviews.Author: Cally-Man
Reviews.Content: You have to start with customer service: unbelievable. This hotel is completely out of our budget for a reason, they treat you like you're special. The best part is, they make you believe it. We were greeted at their lobby by some of the coolest, good looking and friendly staff I've ever come across. The Standard lobby had an atmosphere that some of New York's best clubs can't even rival. The room was sick. Unbelievable view of the Hudson with an excellent front-row seat of sunsets that fall behind the buildings on the water's edge. The bath was outstanding and a great centerpiece to the room. There are only a few bad things I could say about the room and the hotel, what's up with the toiletries? To throw down that kind of cash, you think you'd get some exotic and extravagant soaps and shampoos to douse yourself with. Bring your own hair tonic, the stock toiletries are way below standard. The restaurants were outstanding. Breakfast at the grill was excellent and very relaxing. The bar next to the lobby seemed to have people 24 hours a day, it was very chill and relaxed. The restaurant behind the grill was very cool, dimly lit with a strong crowd all day and night. The beer hall was way sick. Ping pong tables, a big bar, mess-hall style table layout. Legit. Location, location, location. Right around the hotel is a bunch of boutiquey select shops. The hotel itself sits over the old train tracks converted into a walkway. A quick 5 minute walk north on this and you're at Chelsea Marktet. Train stations are also abundant, I think there were two choices putting you about a 10 minute train ride from anywhere you wanted to get in the city. If you need to do a taxi, you're pretty set too. We got a $25 taxi from the LES and a $60 ride to and from JFK. You're also just a 10 minute walk from the West Village, if you go there, hit up a place called the Spotted Pig. Overall, outstanding stay and a perfect compliment to a trip to the best city in the world. This could be the best hotel we have and may ever stay at. Might have to save up and do it again. Thank you very much for a wonderful trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience of the MeatPacking District”
Reviews.Author: Bri R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently wanted a night out away from the kids so decided to treat ourselves to a night out in Manhattan. The Standard was an awesome experience, from the doormen to the concierge everyone made our stay really pleasant. Even when checking out, the front desk manager followed up to make sure we had a great stay. I would highly recommend this hotel for couples!

Reviews.Title: “One of the most beautiful hotels in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: LoveofLiberty
Reviews.Content: I visited over Thanksgiving. I had never stayed there, but heard great things about the look and feel of the place. The Standard is the premier hotel in the vibrant Chelsea district! The desk staff was friendly and accommodating. The concierge, Jesse, had so many great suggestions for places to go, restaurants, clubs. Really excellent. He is an wealth of information and tips for an incredible night. I would recommend taking time to go up to the rooftop bar. It is a real escape and being all glass gives some of the best views of the Hudson and lower Manhattan I have ever seen!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations during business trip...”
Reviews.Author: DanteWoodruff
Reviews.Content: From my initial entry into the property - the Doorman greeted us with a big smile and friendliness was erupting from his voice. The Bellman was prompt and I didn't need to carry anything, open a door, or even push the elevator button. I had to tip him more than I planned for because of his true dedication - and he was greatly appreciative that he said,"Are you sure Sir, I usually only get the most a $20 bill." I am from Matthews, NC and I was on business - and I did not expect NYC to be such a friendly town....glad I picked THE STANDARD....My company has a contract with Hilton, but I chose for personal comfort to derive from that - a colleague recommended this hotel for the overall exceptional quality of the staff and amenities. I have noted for my next visit to NYC during the winter to most likely bring my family this time, as there are many activities for children, and the property has its own ice skating rink. Overall I give this hotel A+++.

Reviews.Title: “An Entire Experience”
Reviews.Author: Micah H
Reviews.Content: Every room in the hotel is an experience! The bar is amazing, the restaurants are top-notch, and the rooms are works of art. The location of the hotel is perfect for any stay in New York. I highly recommend The Standard!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Keith G
Reviews.Content: I can't rave about this hotel enough. From the minute I checked in the bellman and front office staff were so friendly and corteous. They were so helpful in reccomending restaraunts and bars in the surrouding area. The room had an exciting view of the city and was pleasently decorecated. Comfortable bed and great shower to which my girlfriend and I greatly enjoyed. Would reccomend anyone I know to stay here if visiting/travelling to NYC

Reviews.Title: “If those walls could talk”
Reviews.Author: Carlos T
Reviews.Content: Recently visited NYC for business. Booked at the Standard and extended trip entirely on my experience at hotel. Loved it and location. Best staff at a hotel I've ever had the pleasure of encountering.Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: rowena77
Reviews.Content: I loved going to a staycation at the standard. The beds are extremely comfortable, the tub fit 2 adults across, the views are spectacular! The bar at the top of standard is the best place to see the sun go down. great photo opportunities. 18% gratuity is automatically charged at the bar. The standard grill is top notch. There's so much to do around the area. The only downside is that there is some noisey construction happening in the morning

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS BED BUGS ITS JUST THE BEGINNING”
Reviews.Author: j m
Reviews.Content: this just proves that no hotel is safe from these pests. The view looking at NJ is great if your really into panoramic views of the Garden State. Its also really trendy and cool but the bed bugs are a deal breaker. I hope this was just an isolated incident. The location is also super trendy but it really isn't near any major business places i needed to be.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy for sure”
Reviews.Author: Erica G
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Clean and friendly staff. Pricey hotel food...but it is NY. It definately was trendy...possibly a little too trendy for me.

Reviews.Title: “The "Sub-Standard"”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastGal202
Reviews.Content: There are so many other options in the city that provide a much more satisfying stay that I will NOT be staying here again. Location: Great Room: (the good) Terrific floor to ceiling windows with great views. Comfy bed. (the Bad) Bathroom smelled of urine, Glass shower is completely open to the room (no option even for a privacy curtain) and room smelled strongly 'perfumed/deodorized'(?). Some other details within the room left something to be desired (concept seems to have won over functionality). Service: Concierge/Desk staff described in another review as 'complacent'...I would agree. Neither helpful nor hospitable. The other staff was better though. Rooftop lounge: Fantastic panoramic views (IF you can get in). Some of you will want to note it is only open to 'regular folks' until a certain hour. Later in the evening it is 'by list only'... i.e. NOT OPEN TO PAYING HOTEL GUESTS which is ludicrous, exclusionary against the hotel's patrons and, on principle alone, enough for me to book elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms - fabulous views. great for fun, not for bussines”
Reviews.Author: Ivy148
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved our three day stay in this hotel. The Queen Superior room is still quite small. No hook to hung your coat or luggage rack for your suitcase. Internet is â€œcomplimentaryâ€� but never works. You can pay $19.95 a day and get faster working wireless. The views are spectacular. And location is great. Don't miss the bar on top of the hotel. Expensive but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “A big mistake”
Reviews.Author: jaime m
Reviews.Content: I was never in such a small room, beds are very small and you are not allow to get into some of the bars/clubs of the hotel unless you are register. Honestly a big deception.

Reviews.Title: “Hey, life's a Party”
Reviews.Author: LelaM
Reviews.Content: If you travel regularly on business, THIS is the hotel which will make you look forward to your next stay at a Park Hyatt or Four Seasons.... 1) The upside: the views are amazing. There we can start and end this review - truly stunning. Book the corner king "Liberty" for the most incredible Manhattan sunset and sunrise skylines or the "Empire" for the northerly Manhattan vantage - either are great. Accept high floor only....you'll regret it otherwise....just not too high and thus too close to their boom-boom-room (hey, they don't call it that for nothing!). Now the downsides: 2) remember you're booking into a "party hotel". It's >SO< party that you can see the razor blade lines in the tabletops from the worshippers-of-charlie who've previously overnighted in your room. Your neighbours arriving from the local chill-out lounges will ensure you hear the continuation of their party, hours after the party is over... 3) the design of the "wet shower" will ensure that you, and all of your toiletries, are just that: wet. The sinks were bought on the cheap and don't drain properly. Wait til you see where they put the large screen TV's - smack dead in the middle of your expensive Manhattan skyline view (corner room). There's no exhaust fan in the toilet "cabin". That said, whoever purchased the mattresses did well.... 4) "room service" lacks the "service" - coffee day one, 51 minutes flat and coffee day two was under 48 - so don't plan an early check-out. 5) you can also forget a friendly welcome or special guest services - you need to book at the rooftop bar (no special contingency for hotel guests) and same at the restaurant (albeit there are plenty of restaurants, bars, and nightclubs in the area...see 2 above). The limos from Jersey pull up at all hours of the night and you'll hear the inebriated young Jersey girls on the high floors, as well as the low, too. Yes, all that entertainment from the quiet of your own room. Just don't expect the hotel staff to anticipate that you, too, might want a quiet nights sleep as your principle desire in a "hotel". 6) in addition to the expected "Manhattan drone" of cars, horns and street-sounds which you'll hear at any NYC hotel, you can look forward to the semi-trucks arriving to the local meatpacking district meat-packers with their annoying "beep-beep-beep" reverse warning sirens just prior to the arrival of your neighbours from the after hours club (see 2 above). There are also major construction projects on both the north and south side of the hotel - the west rooms all overlook the westside highway (joy, zoom, joy, siren) and the east rooms are all corners - so there is no escape if you crave silence other than earplugs. 7) I'm boring, you are too....so I'll stop here and let your imagination or high fill in any other details.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Foodnwinentravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights after Christmas. Great location, amazing views from the hotel and helpful service and staff. Nice hotel bar. Apparently there's a club ( Boom Boom Room) which is open after 9pm, but hotel guests are not allowed in. You have to be on the guest list, if you're lucky.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise Ship Cabin in the Meat Packing District”
Reviews.Author: BeachChair
Reviews.Content: A bit "too cool for school," you'll find several room quirks where form beats out function by a mile. This may be due to the Lilliputian room size or just the way the hipsters like it. Do not stay below the 8th or above the 12th floor unless you are immune to sound of the club-scene, which is more the target of this hotel. Tell your cab driver to drop you off at the revolving yellow doors, since the a Standard Hotel cheapens the place. Also, bring a miner's headlight so you can see the buttons in the elevator since hipsters have infrared vision and no trouble seeing the numbers.

Reviews.Title: “MISAPPROPRIATE CREDIT CARD CHARGES”
Reviews.Author: Greg O
Reviews.Content: I travel 100% for my job, mostly to NYC EVERY week. I decided to try The Standard. I will NEVER stay here again. I travel corporately and the hotel deceptively puts a $2.00 charge on your bill for a tax deductible donation to the Highline. I get it. $2.00 isn't a big deal, but when you have a corporate card that is heavily monitored, it is a big deal. Their justification is, that there is a "box" you can check when you check-in stating that you do not wish to contribute. However, front desk personnel does NOT tell you about it. SO DECEPTIVE. Additionally, other "charges" have popped up on my credit card bill from The Standard. When addressing these issues with hotel staff, it took forever for the credits to be posted and even longer to get receipts of the credits for verification. This hotel is a JOKE! Financially UNPROFESSIONAL!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mafia between the Concierge and the Hotel's door man”
Reviews.Author: BrazItalia_Travelers
Reviews.Content: The hotel experience overall was very good but the last day we had a very bad experience: we asked for a taxi to go to the airport, there is always some taxi parked in front of the hotel but we allowed the concierge to take care of it. The bell boy did his job bringing the luggage in the taxi, we got into the taxi waiting for it to leave when we saw the taxi driver going towards the bell boy and discretly giving him some bucks in his hand..well we thought 'this guys are doing business together apparently'..but we didn t care too much until more happened: the taxi driver came back in the car and at that point the other taxi drivers (4 of them were there standing infront of our taxi), started laughing and indicating at the wheel saying apparently funny things since they were all very euphoric..our taxi driver was yelling at them nervousely..this last a couple of minutes, we couldn t understand what was going on since they were speaking in indian i think. Long story short our taxi driver finally said to us: i cannot bring you to the airport, this is not my ride, you have to go with another guy..then he came out the taxi and open the car's door..i stepped out and he didn t even help us to move the luggage into the other taxi, nor the other tAxi driver did..apparently there are some 'special rules' to follow in this business that the bell boy didn t followed, for sure customer service is not one of them. The ride in the stinky taxi where we happened to be went ok until the end when we finally were ready to pay: we told him that we wanted to pay by credit card and he promptely replied that there was a fee for that and that was better to pay cash...bad for him we just read on the infos that are available in the taxi that there were no fees for paying with credit card..at that point we couldn t really hold it more and told him a couple of things... The management of this hotel should understand that the experience don t end at the check out and if a guest let a staff member take care of a service, they should also ensure that such service is at a required level. There was a clear interest of some employees in giving business to this horrible taxis and this is not acceptable, especially considering the outcome we experienced. The hotel cannot be responsible for a taxi behaviour but when u do business with them in a certain way they did.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I've ever experienced!!!”
Reviews.Author: wef4
Reviews.Content: I wish I could rate this hotel lower than terrible. I am constantly traveling for business and pleasure and this is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. The staff was not only unwelcoming but downright rude from the moment I checked in. I have never been harassed in such unnecessary manner. I ended up leaving after one night to spend the rest of my trip in a hotel of higher quality.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice in the meatpacking district”
Reviews.Author: AloeKeef
Reviews.Content: Well, the Gansevoort used to be my hotel of choice in the meatpacking district, but after my last stay I decided to give The Standard another shot (I stayed here over a year ago too) and this time they won me over. The rooms are smaller than the Gansevoort, but they are newer and quite comfortable (once you get over the fact that your room is exposed to the world via the floor-to-ceiling windows, that is). The bathrooms have glass walled showers that abut the bed and if you're staying here with someone you're quite intimate with, this can be fun. The shower has very good water pressure despite being one of those stupid "rain shower" heads. The one problem with the shower is that it is not enclosed so water that sprays off of you or the wall just pools up outside the shower soaking your bath mat. The sink in the bathroom is kind of silly form-over-function-esque but not nearly as foolish as those in the "Dream Downtown" rooms. Beds are comfortable, but unfortunately very low to the ground. I despise that trend in hotels. There is a built in "couch" and a small table to eat your unbelievably delicious room service on. That is something that should not be overlooked, by the way; the room service. It is the best I've had at any hotel, both in terms of food quality and the service itself. The staff are so nice and are always very prompt. The food, well, it's just incredible for room service. Do yourself a favor and order at least one meal from room service here. You won't regret it. The rooms have giant LG flat screen tvs mounted on the wall with difficult to use remote controls because of some inexplicable delay between the time you push a button when the tv reacts to that command. I have stayed here several times along with several colleagues in different rooms and it's the same for all of us every single time no matter what room we stay in. It's so strange. The front desk must get hundreds of calls a week about this awful inconvenience. The other bad thing about the Standard is the free wi-fi service. It is PAINFULLY slow because they want you pay $20 a day to upgrade to the faster connection. This is extremely frustrating, especially if you need the service for work. For a modern hotel, they sure do fail in the technology department. Overall, however, the Standard is an excellent hotel and one worth trying for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Victoria C
Reviews.Content: We usually stay on the upper east side,but thought we would try the meat packing district for a different vibe. You are certainly in the thick of thing here, great location next to the highline,and close to the river.Very very trendy, especially at the weekend, when its certainly the place to be seen.The bar on the top floor has exceptional views on the hudson, service was very very slow and with attitude.We all had dinner in the grill on the first night, it was ok but not outstanding.Great shopping around the area, you dont really need to go up town, everything is here,Chelsea Market is especially good.I would certainly stay here again,due to the location and the vibe.Our room was on the 15th floor - cant remember what class of room ,it was not the cheapest nor the more expensive,it had a strange built in table with bench built around it,ok if you were to eat in the room, but seemed a strange use of space.The room had good hanging space,amazing river views and an adequate bathroom with large walk in shower and very deep bath.If you enjoy running there is a great running track along the river which is busy with cyclists,runners and walkers, it's safe and well lit( good for an early morning jet lag run)there s a gym with amazing views, but I did not venture up there.We stayed here in November and they were getting the ice rink ready for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Feedback - The Standard”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: Overall cool hotel - ice skating rink etc a nice touch (of course at a cost as is everything at this place). Concierge - rude and unhelpful (at least the ones I dealt with). Living in HK and a 13 hour time difference I sent a request for a couple of restaurant bookings. No reply. Followed up and was told (by reception) to email the concierge. They stand next to each other! Arrived and called concierge one morning to see if they could help with tickets to 9-11 memorial. Response was (quote) "no - go online and book yourself". USD 400 a night - really??? Stayed at SoHo Grand last trip and they were a delight. Next trip - no more Standard! Oh and so noisy - drunks at all hours in hallways. Staff no help when called. Locked out of room due to faulty door locks - service staff who fixed locks the only nice people we met.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location in a fun part of town.”
Reviews.Author: fleurdsoleil
Reviews.Content: I visit New York fairly often, and try to stay in different hotels / neighborhoods as much as possible. This was my first time staying in the Meat Packing district and I absolutely loved it. About the hotel: --Stayed in a deluxe king, great view of the Hudson and the High Line path, decent size room, floor to wall windows, and huge tub if that is important to you. Also important to note: people can see into your room from down below e.g. windows are not privacy screened / darkened, so don't be thinking you can walk around your room in the buff without curtains drawn. --Top of the Standard: inside the hotel itself, the top floor bar with great views and really good vibe, go there before 9 or 9:30PM as it closes to the public and becomes an exclusive access type venue. --Staff: I had a great experience with the staff, everyone from door men to concierge to receptionist were super helpful and friendly. Although cabs are plentiful around here (there was always a line right outside the lobby waiting to go), the subway is only a couple blocks away. Super easy to get to all the points of interest around Manhattan. But before you venture out, spend some time in the surrounding neighborhood, as it has some great things to see / experience. There are too many to write but here are a few: --The High Line: nice, elevated walk way that was once a railroad line, great vantage points giving you a different view of the West side --Chelsea Market: super cool indoor market with a bunch of shops, primarily food (bakeries, coffee shops, lunch-type places) and grocery. --Shopping: lots of stores for either buying or browsing including Sephora, Diane Von Furstenburg, Vince, Tory Burch, etc.. --Night time restaurants: We ate at one of several seemingly great options, Scarpetta (YUM italian), there is no need to travel far to get good grub, wether you want casual or a bit upscale. Neighboring Chelsea having a ton of great options. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kellyincville
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard king room 0811. Pros: -Great part of town. Close to everything but out of the hustle of midtown. -The view from the room was amazing. We could see the statue of liberty, the empire state building and the new freedom towers going up. Love! -Very comfy bed. Fun open shower. -The 8th floor was a perfect choice for us. All the views but none of the noise from the club on the 18th. -Love the highline park. Very unexpected treat in Manhattan. -Overall the staff was very attentive and helpful, with one exception noted below. Cons: -The club on the 18th is an inconvenience to those staying at the hotel. The view is not as good as the rooms' (at least our room). The service is noticeably snobby and different from the other restaurants/bars in the hotel. The waitresses/hostesses are all waif-ish wannabe models waiting to be discovered and not so much interested in clearing tables, taking orders, etc. Also not a very good scene on the night we were there; lots of boys in hooded sweatshirts spending daddy's money. -The people walking the highline park can see in the rooms very clearly. And evidently (from friends with apartment nearby), it is a pastime for nearby residents to sit on their roofs with binoculars. Be warned! -There was construction going on in the floors above us from about 1030am - 430pm each day. We were not told at check-in and heard the details from another guest when my husband and I were talking in the elevator. I expect those kinds of details to be disclosed by the hotel staff. -The elevators are a little strange. Very dark with a photoshop video montage going on loop on two screens. Maybe entertaining at 3am with a good buzz heading up to the Top of the Standard but at 10am on your way out? A little irritating to have to use your cell phone light to see the numbers.

Reviews.Title: “little cold. little out of the way. isolated.”
Reviews.Author: jacksondc
Reviews.Content: don't get me wrong, it's a nice hotel. it's a little too "too" for me, including a confusing front door/entrance, a club that's only open to non-hotel guests (huh?) and hallways that are on the hospital side of hospitable. the pluses are the people - from doormen who met us 1/2 a block a way from the front door to check-in personnel, they were friendly, able and willing to help. the rooms are only ok...nothing to write home about. not quite cutting edge (is anything anymore?) and not quite comfortable....just ok. there's not a bar, but a lounge where you can't see the bartender or chat with him about advice for the hood. it wasn't a bad stay, just an odd stay. oh, but the pillows were out of this world! one piece of advice - pay for the largest room possible to be truly wow'd. we didn't. wish we would have. oh, and go during the spring, summer or fall. it's desolate in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_now387
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the middle of meatpacking. Loved the location and the food. Can really recomend the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special...but amazing view”
Reviews.Author: silix
Reviews.Content: Is it definitely a cool place, but as a hotel is not worth what it costs. The rooms were poor . Accessories in the bedroom and bathroom were poor as well. Service were not so good as that structure could have to require. The Hotel was Wretched in general, but with a beautiful view of the River

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: milena_dj
Reviews.Content: Phenomenal attention to details, good food and comfortable rooms. Service in Standard Grill downstairs was great, but I can't say the same for the reception guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Dreadful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Elysia
Reviews.Content: We booked a Standard King room and we got just that - a very standard room. We stayed two nights. We Liked: + Great location in the Meat Packing District. + The video art installation in the lift is mesmerizing. + The Top lounge/bar - an experience - incredible view outside & in! + Contemporary design of the public areas. + Pleasant (but not extraordinary) view over the High Line from full height glazing. We disliked: - Very slow wait to check-in after a very long flight. - Complacent staff. - Narrow corridors - felt like a cheap motel. - Tiny and very cramped room. - Grubby beige carpet. - No storage for bags and very little hanging space. - Had to use the seating/desk area for bag storage. - No tea or coffee making facilities. - The shower flooded into the small bathroom space, slippery floor. - The curtain track was pulling off the ceiling with the weight of the heavy drapes. - It's funky & hip - but maybe we're a little too old for this! It's rather sad when you reflect on your experience of a hotel and remember the elevator ride as the highlight of your stay. Would we return? No!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Aaron S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really top notch. Wonderful service and amenities. The staff could not have been nicer and the location really allows you to be anywhere in the city within 20 minutes. I look forward to coming back to The Standard the next time I visit New York. A one of a kind experience.

Reviews.Title: “True NYC”
Reviews.Author: sbajaj621
Reviews.Content: One too many benefits to staying here although there are its down sides. For a young guy like me, staying at this hotel is an experience. Given its Meatpacking location, this hotel attracts a very Euro crowd and is a very big hang out spot. The Top of the Standard is a must visit with its 360 views of NYC including the Hudson River, Financial District and up north towards Midtown. The rooms are for those couples seeking something new - full clear view floor to ceiling windows, open shower and tub, etc etc. I've stayed in the queen hudson room, king hudson view room and the terrace suite. Would highly recommend you go for a King room at the least. The main downside I know of at this hotel is that the front desk and concierge are essentially the same so on a busy check-in day, don't expect to get a pickup from concierge for reservations or recommendations. This hotel is the center of what's happening in NYC. Stay here if you are intending to have a big night out and not necessarily need to take a cab everywhere. Highly recommended in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location...Rooms Just OK”
Reviews.Author: bobolito
Reviews.Content: We love the Standard NYC for food and drink and go there often. We spent 2 nights there recently and we were slightly disappointed in the rooms and service. The deluxe King is a closet and the space is weird. We knew that going in though. The bathroom is in middle of room with all glass and no doors...OK, I get the glass, but it was so cold and drafty you hated to take a shower. There was virtually no room for a waste basket in the bathroom and no hooks to hang towels. The room smelled of cigarette smoke. Waste baskets were dirty and the house keeping does just minimal cleanup during the daily cleaning....no wiping soap build up in shower and then some......the cleaning is just a touch up really but for the price you would think it should be more...maybe it's pride but I would make sure all my housekeeping staff really cleaned thoroughly. The view of Empire State Building was just OK...You really need to be on the highest floor for a better view and the hotel sits in an area that has a lot of buildings in front of it. Beds were great. As mentioned earlier, the Standard Grille is amazing...one of the coolest spots in NYC. It sits right in the Meat Packing District and right off the West side and a block away from the Hudson River. The food is always great at the Grille and one of our favorite brunch spots. If you are up for a fun loud beer garden, with so much to see...this is the spot. The winter ice rink looks real sweet with the warming house...will be back with my child. The 18th floor bar open to guests only was closed due to a private party. Will come back to the bars and restaurant probably not the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and arrogant.”
Reviews.Author: Themanagerisadick
Reviews.Content: Came over from the UK for a pre Xmas shopping trip. We love New York and our favourite hotel - Soho House was full so we were referred to The Standard or Substandard as it is soon to be renamed.$22 for two coffees in your room!!! Thumping music late Into the night. 4.00 am and still going. Queues of limos outside blowing thier horns, police to control the traffic and the internal walls thumping to beat of the nightclub on the 18th floor. We stayed on the 9th and it still kept me from sleeping. I some to the manager, hi self a complete anus with zero wimple skills. Essentially told me I was imagining it. Completely rude arrogant little man who spends more time bleaching his teeth to the point of transparency than he does trying to show his guests a good time. If you don't want to live on the nightclub - stay away!

Reviews.Title: “rooftop bar amazing view”
Reviews.Author: piemontes
Reviews.Content: view is really amazing! a drink will cost you as much as a ticket in rockfeller center or empire st building elevator. if you are not staying in the hotel, don't forget to try the restrooms, an experience of thei own

Reviews.Title: “NYC Weekend Trip”
Reviews.Author: Tom S
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is amazing. We've had a wonderful room with great view to the Empire State building. Everything was clean, and people didn't have any attitude. It was my first time in NYC and when I come back I definitely will take the same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard in name only”
Reviews.Author: Barry C
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself enjoyed 4 nights over the Thanksgiving holiday at The Standard to celebrate her 40th birthday. It was a wonderful experience - excellent accommodation, food, facilities, location and generally helpful staff. As with most New York hotels the room size was not over generous but the use of the space was very clever. My only criticism is that the staff at the entrance to the fancy bar at the top of the hotel, which is super cool with amazing views, should probably chill out a bit and treat their guests as guests. The doorman took a bottle of water off my wife (who is 7 months pregnant) in a pretty abrupt way. Implementing rules with courtesy and a smile is usually more effective.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, bright rooms with great views and great room service”
Reviews.Author: MyPorch
Reviews.Content: Our four-night Thanksgiving weekend stay was actually our second time at The Standard. We first stayed there when the hotel had their "soft opening" before the hotel was completely finished. Both stays were very good. The best thing about The Standard is that no matter what type of room you get, you won't ever have to look out your window at a brick wall or an air shaft. How many times have you stayed at a nice hotel known for its views and ended up in the a room that looks at a brick wall? No natural light or air, etc. The way The Standard is situated on its own block and the way it is designed makes that sad situation is an impossibility. The Room: For me the light and air (and views) and just the general feeling of coziness make up for any cons, but read on for the cons...Like most NYC hotel rooms, this one is definitely on the small side. We had two full size suit cases that we never really found a good place for. Small closet with a fabric curtain rather than a door. And the bed itself is flush against the bathroom wall on one side so only one sleeper has immediate access to the floor. There is a kind of swivel table/desk over near the fantastic floor to ceiling window wall that works quite well for work or for eating. Nice big flat screen. The bathroom is one of those open plan types with a gigantic glass window in the shower/tub that looks out into the room. It lets in lots of light to the bathroom but you have to make sure no one is using the shower when room service arrives. There is a separate room for the toilet itself. The tub/shower is enormous but the drain is right smack in the middle of the tub which can make it slightly awkward taking a shower or even a bath. The rain showerhead is nice but, again, like many hotels, if you are 6'2" you have to bend a bit to fit under it. The Bed: On the softer side. We tend to like a firmer mattress and this one after four days had me pining for my bed at home. Linens and comforter were very cozy and clean. The Views and Location: Even the rooms that don't face the river still have river views. And your consolation is a superstar view of the sky line with the Empire State Building. If you have a room on the other side of the building you have to make do with a fantastic river/harbor view of the Statue of Liberty.Surrounded by pretty good upper end shopping and restaurants. Definitely an urban/warehouse feeling to the quickly gentrifying neighborhood and great proximity to the West Village as well as the parkway along the Hudson. Of course the hotel also straddles the fantastic High Line park which is a joy in itself, but also a great way to walk as far north as 30th Street without having to deal with cars. Service: Sometimes these hip hotels can make anyone who isn't a fashion model feel like an idiot. Not so at The Standard. Everyone we dealt with (with the possible exception of the excellent restaurant) was friendly and didn't throw of any kind of attitude. Room service was particularly good. My husband had a cold most of the time so we stayed in more than we would normally and I was always amazed at how fast the food came. From phone call to hot breakfast was only 15 minutes. Food: Room service food was good and fast. The Grill restaurant was comfy, had a great menu with lots of variety, and was really delicious. Lunch we could do as a walk-in, but evening meals require reservations well in advance--although they do take walk-ins even if you can't get a reservation. Amenities: The fitness center on the 17th floor was well-equipped, open 24/7, and had unbelieveable views. Room had a very well stocked mini-bar with reasonable-ish prices. Bathroom amenties are Kiss My Face and have a distinctive, not overpowering, clean smell. On demand choices on the flat screen were kind of on the lame side, not much choice, but the cable stations had more than your typical choices (like Bravo, etc.) but also had about five channels of art documentaries which were great. Free WiFi was plenty fast, but you could also upgrade for 19.95 a day for faster connection. The video art installation in each of the elevators was mesmerizing and made riding the elevator fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Georgia M
Reviews.Content: The Standard Hotel has been our favorite since our daughter moved to the West Village last year. We first stayed there last December because it was so close to her apartment. But now that we have experienced the wonderful restaurant and outstanding service, it is our go-to hotel in NYC. Although we tend to raise the average age in the lobby when we are checking in, we have always been welcomed and well cared for.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Hip, Great Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: travelingteacher14
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at The Standard for 2 nights this past October. We knew before heading to New York that we wanted to stay in the Meatpacking District and we had our eyes set on taking as many pictures as possible in the Highline Park. This hotel allowed us both. The service here was fantastic! From the minute our driver dropped us off on the curb to the minute we left, I felt special and appreciated. The concierge took our bags from the curb, brought us to check-in (where we were able to check in at 9 AM complete with a free room upgrade!) He brought our bags to our room, opened the curtains, gave us a little tour of the room, the mini-bar, etc. Told us the best places to eat and check out in the area, etc. The views from this hotel are sweeping. Aside from the fact that the hotel literally overlooks the Highline Park, we also had an amazing view of the Empire State Building. I was blown away! The rooms, however, while modern were a little dated. The bed was comfy, but the bedding needs to be updated. The bathroom, however, was great. I loved the rain shower. The hotel property overall is amazing though. Between the restaurant, bars, the coffee shop, and the little Octoberfest beer garden, we were pleasantly surprised with all of the choices right at our finger tips. The meat packing district was hip, trendy, and a great place for any 20+ year old to socialize and have fun. It was warm and mild the first week of October and all of the restaurants had outdoor patios and places to eat. We were surprised by the options in this neighborhood. It was clean and just had a great vibe to it! At times, in shorts and a hooded sweatshirt (I did feel a little under dressed). So plan accordingly (as NYC is where the fashion is made!) While you will probably pay a lot to stay here (we did) it was well worth the extra 100 dollars or so (especially after seeing some of the dark and dank hotels in Times Square that were only about 100 dollars less a night). If you are looking to be close to the Highline, want something trendy, and are looking for a great NYC neighborhood- I definitely recommend The Standard!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and super convenient to shopping and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: mtnwmn
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for a couple nights and had a blast. We had my little chihuahua w/us and got in trouble for taking her out for a walk in Highline Park. Otherwise the stay was lovely! Great galleries and shopping. Fun sister trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but rooms were not so great”
Reviews.Author: jjjntf
Reviews.Content: I love the Meatpacking District in NY - lots to do, great restaurants and the Standard is built right over top of the Highline, plus just a jump to the West Village. The room we had was trying to be too cool for it's own good. The bathroom small, the sink unusable (a cool, not too deep sink with a big goose faucet that just spattered everywhere, and the rain showerhead didn't have much pressure. The bed was comfy, but there was a very annoying fan in the ceiling that kept going off throughout the night. At first we thought we could hear the neighbours shower running because it sounded like running water, but it did it on and off at all times. Actually woke us up a couple of time. The best part of the hotel is the elevator video loop. The Standard Grill is very very good, but maybe just come in for the brunch and a jump in the elevator instead of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Novemeber 2011”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: Our 4 day stay at The Standard was as enjoyable as ever. Its a great place to stay with bucketfuls of entertainment just minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: BrionUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks great. The mid-price room was lovely. The GIANT bathtub was a virtually an in-room plunge pool. The view from my third floor room over the HighLine was superb - high enough to feel private, but low enough for amazing people watching. But the staff were just nasty. Check-in was frosty. Zero smiles. Minimal eye contact. And I had to ask where the elevators were, which is a) not obvious and b) added to a feeling of not being welcome. That first evening we had dinner and then returned late for a night cap. The bar was full, but the lobby area was empty. I asked in the bar if I could order drinks and take them to the lobby. The hostess said "No. That's a LOBBY. This is BAR". I had seen people hanging out in the lobby before, using the WiFi, sipping coffee etc. I decided to risk it, as I felt that I was paying enough to be able to use the facilities available. I asked for a cocktail menu and we sat in the lobby. I then saw that I'd been given a food menu. I went back and asked again for a cocktail menu. I was told I could order there and then. I did and told the hostess I'd be in the lobby. The drinks never came. Not a great beginning to a 5 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Still here now with 6 nights to go....”
Reviews.Author: TheCroc
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay here since I first saw this hotel featured on TV in Australia. Staying 10 nights here and contacted the hotel to find the best rooms considering our situation and really wanted a view for my wife. Arrived here last Thursday and was told a reception that I should upgrade, the room that I had booked would not be suitable for my wife and 4 year old! I booked the room and paid 10 nights in advance on their recommendation. Our phone does not work on it's hand set, our TV needed room service to sort out, the base of the chair in our room is hanging on by one screw! I know this as the other fell out prior to writing this. Service is very hit and miss, although I must say that the Standard Bar and Grill was sensational. Had my birthday there and could not fault it... Our room is ok, but some parts are very tired.... Will be interesting to see the help I get come Thursday and trying to get some info about the Macy parade, sure as he'll hope that it's better than the info they gave me last night to get to the Giants football.....no not soccer! This is a very funky architectural hotel, no fault there. There seems to be something missing. I am a customer that has prepaid close to $4000 but you wouldn't think it. Oh, they have no coffee making facilities...so it's $10 for late night coffee. $4.00 for it to be delivered.

Reviews.Title: “A bit too hipster”
Reviews.Author: bondi76
Reviews.Content: Very cool hotel, great architecture, great location, great views, interesting room design. BUT, the rooms are tiny with only space for one suitcase, its overpriced - we had just come from the W Hotel on Lexington where we paid less for a room twice the size. We stayed 6 nights and there was no discounted rate, they told our travel agent that they would do something with an upgrade - nothing came of this. We also prepaid as the aussie dollar has been so strong - 5 weeks after we gave them our credit card details, they processed the payment - at that moment the exchange rate was at its lowest for 12 months, this cost us about $300. The service is just a bit crap as well, every is just too cool to give a ....

Reviews.Title: “A bit chaotic, frankly”
Reviews.Author: James O
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there on business on a couple of occasions -- the first time for a week and the second time for three nights. The lobby is quite hip and the rooms and views interesting. On each visit things went wrong. The bathroom with mid-room shower head flooded because the floor wasn't sloped properly to drain. In another situation the boom-boom from the nightclub above made sleeping difficult. One night a guest on another floor dropped a cigarette at 1:30am and they evacuated us for an hour. I had a room change (because of the boom-boom of the nightclub mentioned above) and it took three calls for them finally to deliver my bag from old room to new one. I hesitated in writing a negative review because the staff there could not have been more friendly, but the place is a major party destination and has some big design flaws like the bathroom flooding. This is definitely not the place to go if you actually want to get a modicum of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Clean, Efficient!”
Reviews.Author: BosguyBoston
Reviews.Content: We just spent another weekend at The Standard. We stay there every time we go to NYC. It is fun: very sharp design, very good restaurants and great service. It is a special experience. So chic even 60 year old travelers like us enjoy the kick the place gives. We do laugh at the picture window from the bathroom that overlooks the bedroom, but what the hell. More fun.

Reviews.Title: “Pubic hair in room service food”
Reviews.Author: Gf0rce
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room so the views of the city were amazing. There is limited space for luggage but the room was clean and bright. I would have perhaps given a more favourable score had I not been grossed out by a breakfast I ordered from room service.. Eggs benedict were delivered to my room. I lifted the cloche to unveil not only a long hair through the breakfast but a pubic hair too. When I phoned room service to say I hadn't ordered the 'extras' the guy made the mistake of saying "I very much doubt you have pubic hair on your plate"... I said, "I know what pubic hair looks like and there's one on my plate". Whereupon, I marched down with the tray to the restaurant to show the manager. Apologies as expected. Another eggs benedict was sent to my room which I couldn't face eating. And a bottle of prosecco to make up for the wig incident. I wouldn't put anyone off going there, but I would recommend you eat elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Setting a new standard..”
Reviews.Author: Ecogourmande
Reviews.Content: The still fairly new Standard Hotel in NYC has everything to please a young(ish)- easygoing - stylish- funseeking couple. The location is bang in the beating heart of Manhattan. The interior is of course beautiful and original, the exterior is very special, and thought it wasn't love at first sight, we grew to really appreciate it. The views are literally mindblowing, over the Hudson and Manhattan, and with the new walkway just below, you can get to anywhere in Manhattan walking/rollerblading or biking. The service is professional and friendly, and not snotty like in some 'stylish' hotels. The restaurants are ( at least at the time we visited) the place to be. definitely visit the bars on the superior levels; they offer unparalled views, of the skyline, the sunset and the fashionista's ( inside).It must be said, service in the jazz bar was a key lower than in the other venues; could have been due to the crowd, but they should be used to that . Oh, and do order fries here ;) - even if just as aniblle with the cocktails -a little surprise awaits ..And do try the nightclub- we went on wednesday eve, the 'rock' evening. WOW, that was something else, coming from techno-obsessed Belgium. Lots of laughs. Don't forget bring your swimmers !!

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing service at The Standard Rooftop bar”
Reviews.Author: MissL123
Reviews.Content: Having booked a table at the rooftop bar on the evening of Monday 7 November we arrived to be told our table was not ready. Waited around 15 minutes to be seated. Once seated and 30 minutes later we had still not been served. One poor cocktail waitresses rushing around. Went to the bar to investigate, told someone would come over, someone did about 10 minutes later, to ask if we'd been served. No, not yet. Another 10 minutes went by. No service. We got up and left. Fantastic view. Bar: style over substance.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Hype!”
Reviews.Author: DrLexLondon
Reviews.Content: A truly FANTASTIC hotel â€“ as good as the hype for once. We stayed in one of the smaller queen rooms, albeit higher up and facing the Hudson â€“ highly recommended. Small but perfectly formed and felt much larger due to brilliant design â€“ stylish AND functional, with an entire wall for a window. Comfy bed, lovely shower, separate loo cubicle (much appreciated in such close quarters). The rest of the hotel is as good if not better. Super design, very well maintained, always buzzing with beautiful people (more Hollywood than NY), with excellent food and drink throughout. The Top of the Standard Bar is an absolute must: massive panoramic, insanely glamorous in a 1920s-on-acid style, with the best cocktails in town and that's saying something as this town is New York. Perfect brunches at the Standard Grill - or anytime eating, for that matter, though we only did mornings. One down side: our room on the 14th-floor suffered from clearly audible club music every day until the early hours. Unless you are happy with ear plugs or fancy staying at said club 'til closing time, make sure you ask for a room as far away from it as possible. In any case, we will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and sexy yet perfectly comfortable”
Reviews.Author: klytia
Reviews.Content: When I think of all the trendy hotels that exist I usually find them to be a little to slick or "cold"...too modern. The Standard is definitely as sleek as they come but still manages to feel warm and even a little homey. The building itself looks imposing and stark but there's a lot to be found on the ground floor. The Standard Grill and the Biergarten outside the hotel on street level are both amazing in their own distinct ambiance. The Biergarten especially has a very fun convivial atmosphere to it. The lobby is dark and trendy with beautiful staff to get you all checked in. Finding the elevators is a bit of a task but then you're on your way. I was fortunate enough to stay in a Deluxe King room that faced south. Walking into that room, you're immediately floored. The view is to die for through the complete wall of floor-to-ceiling windows. Just looking down on the High Line (a park created on miles of abandoned elevated train tracks) and the river and out at the city lights...I never wanted to leave my room. The bed is one of the most comfortable I have ever encountered. And one of the best nights sleep I've had in recent memory. The only drawback to the room design is the open shower. It's so open air that even though the rainshower fixture keeps you soaked, it's easy to get chilled while you're showering. The seating area and table in the Deluxe room added even more space to a room that already feels grand due to those infamous windows. The neighborhood itself is chock full of activities for day and night, the High Line park, fabulous restaurants (see my other review of Spice Market), decadent bars and lounges, great shopping. The Standard raises the bar in comfort AND sophisticated style. Would recommend to anyone for something special.

Reviews.Title: “Mod feel, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: malalucina
Reviews.Content: You'll notice the decor has a mod-feel to it, with its shag rugs, patterned walls and plastic chairs. the video in the elevator is not to be missed, you'll be entranced! overall a very fun, creative vibe. I was impressed with the room as the design is very space-efficient. The WC is the only thing that's behind a door; the bathtub/shower is in the middle of the room and surrounded by glass! It was fantastic. Water pressure, soap, shampoo and lotion accommodations were perfect. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was finished off with a wall-mounted flat-screen and bench seating with a desk. Free wi-fi. The only downside was that the boom boom room (the roof top bar) could be heard well after 3 a.m.; however, my colleagues who stayed on lower floors (I was on floor 15) couldn't hear it at all. Staff is helpful and accommodating. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “(chic & funky) + (tiny and expensive) = not great value”
Reviews.Author: StevenBSydney
Reviews.Content: Look; no doubt this place is uber cool...it's tops and in a great location. However, the queen rooms are $550 and tiny! They are designed for one and have close to zero wardrobe space. This would be ok as most of us (admit it!) use the floor-drobe, and there is only space for two bags on floor if you start to move furniture. This Standard only gets away with it 'cos this is not the place you want to hang around in your room. The neighbourhood invites constant exploration and the room is only your changing/sleeping HQ. It has a great, cool first impression (CookeCL was right though; why the hell is the lobby full of non guest sticky beaks?) and the lifts are Dali-esque cool.
